ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Fedral Humanity Force (FHF) is a civil rightsâ€™ group comprised of advocates, social activists and grassroots para- legal social workers dedicated to using the legal system to protect and advance the civil and human rights in India. FHF, a non- profit and governmental civil rightsâ€™ group was set up in 2013 to defend the rights of the underprivileged sections of the society. FHF is committed to the protection of society from violation of human rights, Illegal detentions, custodial deaths, fake encounters, false cases on the behest of political exigencies, unprovoked firing on demonstrators, criminal negligence of officials and public servants at the time of natural and manmade calamities and consumer frauds by local manufacturers and service providers and Multinational Companies. FHF conducts training workshops on criminal law and human rights issues, investigates in to cases of human rightsâ€™ violations, undertakes cases of public interests with a view to bring about a comprehensive change in criminal justice system, addresses issues of prisoners rights, keeps a watch over law making process to make positive intervention, involves in awareness of general masses and initiates campaigns on various sociolegal issues.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Recently we completed the project Livelihood Project of Mushroom Cultivation. In this project we doubled farmers income and set the self employment models in villages based on Mushroom cultivation. Due to best practices in Rural areas our Chairman Ranjana Rawat has been Designated the Member of Rural Development and Migration Commission And Board member of VCSG Ukttarakhand University of Hort. and Forestry, Bharsar by Govt. of Uttarakhand. She is also brand ambassador of BBBP in Rudraprayag.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: In the first year of NGO registration we started working with self contribution of all NGO members.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: UGVS Department of Rural Development Government of Uttarakhand
sourceOfFunds.purpose: This project was IFAD-Externally Funded. Major objectives was To demonstrate Mushroom production unit for generating more income through it. To demonstrate new innovative and profitable farming option for the villagers. To provide alternate livelihood option round the year in wild animal infestation areas. To ensure round the year Mushroom production in adverse climatic conditions to generate income. To introduce the self-employment enterprise model for generation of cash income.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Global Knowledge Network Society (GKNS), believes in promoting quality education, is both a social imperative and a strategic one. The social imperative is that education leads to greater equality, better health outcomes, higher incomes, more active engagement in democracy, and more awareness of human rights. We have conducted workshops in rural areas and interiors of the country to promote education for Tribals, the Girl Child and encourage parents to enroll their students so that the Gross Enrollment Ratios (GER) of the rural areas can improve. Along with the workshops, programs on use of sustainable energy in daily lives i.e. use of Solar Lamps and renewable sources of energy has also be done. Skilled Children around the use of the sustainable forms of energy. GKNS is also assisting FICCI in formation of Education Sector Skill Council under the aegis of the National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC) which has been set up with the express mandate to â€œcatalyzeâ€ (advocate, create, fund, facilitate and incentivize) skill development in India.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Gram Swarajya Mandal , Someshwar is working since 41 years in the field of Rural Department and social awareness. Since beginning our prime motto is promote village industry. Our society is working in various fields, which is given blow (1)Swap Program :- Our Organization have 80 villages in District Almora for the planning, survey and implementation phase in Swap program. In this program we do community awarness, CAP, HESA program. We are doing survey and making estimate for water scheme of these G.P(Gram Panchayat). We have completed Pre Feasibility Report (PFR) of 36 villages for jal nigam Almora in which we give total detail of these Gram Panchayat. In Swap program of Jal Nigam Almora, we are making estimate for water supply scheme in 27 villages. As total, we have 98 Gram Panchayat in District Almora in Swap Program. (2) Sanitation Work :- Our organization is working currently in 48 Gram Panchayat in four different block in Almora district in total sanitation program of Swajal. In this program our organization motivates the GP for cleaning their houses and motivate the GP to make toilet in every house. We are giving them information of current government schemes and funds for them for total sanitation. By our efforts we made Eight Gram Panchayat Nirmal Gram. (3)Kosi Priyojana :- Our organization is working for prevention of Kosi river from last five years.In this program we motivate the people to make efforts to prevent kosi. For this a movement named â€œ Kosi Bachao Andolanâ€ as held by us with the help of other supporting organization. (4) Environment Conservation:- We are working as a partner society of national Environment awareness program since last 10 years in which the awareness activities and action component is implemented. (5) Awareness Program :- Our organization is working many awareness program as Environment awareness, Agriculture awareness, Health awareness and Educational awareness. (6) Village industry :- We have a spices unit and a turpentine and resin unit - In spices unit we parches spices from local farmers. We also give them training of advance farming with scientific method. (7) Working with NABARD:- Our organization is also working with NABARD by forming Kisaan Club in Rural areas. We also work with S.H.G. in District Almora. (8)Working with NCSTC (DST):- organization is working in 16 villages to train them for Eco Jal- Sakcharta, Eco Eureka. (9)Working with DSTO:- Our organization is working with Innovative Project for masons(Rajmistri), in almora district.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Although the society was registered in June 1999 but its length of service is quite long. It has been carrying out its social services in rural areas of Uttarakhand. Society was registered with basic aim of providing social services to all community particularly to youth, women, children and disabled persons residing in rural areas of Uttarakhand. Experience society has been carrying out activities for the welfare of women and children. These activities include organization of awareness camp, vocational training program family planning & construction of low cost toilet, rain water harvesting tank & fodder pot etc. The society has been experience able to achieve this work by joining hands With UNICEF, Swajal, Jalshanshthan, LIPH & TSC. As a result The society has acquired good experience in this field. So far, it employs 25 people on full time basis and has a training hall that accommodates 300 participants. Residential capacity for 100 people & it has 5 office of which three are rented & two are own. Society has two vehicles & 10 computers. Society has published an advertisement for recruiting new staff for the project.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: NGO received fund from ONGC under corporate social responsibility (CSR) for Food Processing Centre. All the details of the project is discussed in annual report of the NGO. And the information related to funds is in the balance sheet of the respective financial years
Uttarakhand Government chose our NGO for training program under Panchayat Raj. In this project our NGO had to provide training to the Gram Pradhan, Block Pramukh, etc
Our NGO under the guidance of Panchayat Raj gave training to the Gram Pradhan, Gram Pramukh, etc about their responsibilities and rights.

With the help of fund given by CSR ONGC, NGO was able to setup an food processing centre to help poor farmers with empowerment by using the raw material in making jelly, jam, juice which they later on sold in the market to earn money. This skill development practice helped farmers in utilizing the self grown raw material in more effective way.

With the help of ONGC CSR funding, our NGO constructed toilets for the schools in rural areas of Purola Block. Because of unavailability of toilets children were facing lot of problems. However our NGO helped schools by constructing toilets for them. This not only solved the problem of students but also improved sanitary condition of the schools.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Gramin Utthan Samiti kapkote is situated at about 3000 feetâ€™s height which is sub divided into 03 blocks. Head quarter named as KAPKOTE is an agricultural area which is totally depends on the natural rains, which is not sufficient for their survival. Owing to this 70% of them have to go for work to nearby towns/cities. All the work at home, like looking after the cattle & agriculture is surrounded by the women. Men are working in the armed forces and hotels. When they donâ€™t send money home, their families suffer and not able to spend on their needs and on their health. Provision of reproductive health services is generally poor in this district BAGESHWAR & women are majority lack access to saves appropriate and timely health care. BAGESHWAR is a DISTT of kumaoun, which renamed under medieval feudal system. The fact is also contributed to its isolation; villages are small and scattered, making delivery of health services extremely difficult. The hilly terrain makes it difficult to transport sick people too far â€“ 0ff hospitals. Untrained birth attendants conduct 90% of all deliveries, improper antenatal and postnatal care led to RTI and high maternal and child morbidity and mortality. Lack of motivation and awareness has led to poor immunization and malnourished status of children. Gramin Utthan Samiti is a national MNGO (1979) & contributes towards its mission & goal for improving RCH in accordance with the policy of Govt. of INDIA. Its main objectives are to promote the health status of people with maximum emphasis to women, children & adolescent. Beside this GUS does various program like environmental health-e.g. water & sanitation by providing safe drinking water & construction of low cost toilets, income generating program, local governance, capacity building of volunteers in field level (orientation/ training to village health workers, community

ngoList.title: Green Hills Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Green Hills Trust was established in 2014 by a group of concerned citizens of Almora District to protect the environment so that present and future generations can enjoy the natural beauty, wonderful climate and abundant resources of the foothills of the Himalayas. We are trying to limit the damage to Nature caused by people. We are concerned about the disappearance of forests, the depleting biodiversity, the loss of natural habitats for wild animals, the drying up of mountain springs, the pollution of rivers with sewage, non-biodegradable waste being dumped on hillsides and along pathways, the chemicals used to grow our food, public health, the loss of traditional, sustainable livelihoods and about climate change. We believe that concerted and far-sighted action is required by government and citizens together to save the Himalayan region and that youth should be the motor of that change. Our priorities are: ïƒ˜ Organizing environment-friendly waste management; ïƒ˜ Preventing pollution of mountain springs, streams and rivers; ïƒ˜ Protecting bio-diversity and encouraging reforestation; and ïƒ˜ Promoting organic farming. MANAGING WASTE We have been raising awareness and developing systems for environment-friendly solid waste management by applying the three â€˜Râ€™s - Reduce, Reuse, Recycle. We are promoting segregation of waste at source, door-to-door collection of it, indoor composting of green waste, recycling of inert materials and controlled incineration of hospital and insanitary waste. We want to put a stop to littering, dumping and open burning of waste through creating awareness, offering community-based alternatives and demanding the imposition of fines on those who violate the rules. PREVENTING POLLUTION OF WATER SOURCES We have helped to clear the waste thrown into naulas, the mountain springs with which Almora was doted. With help from those who depend on these water sources, we intend to build a structure around them that keeps the water clean and makes it easily accessible. Our clean-up operations concentrate on removing waste from slopes near streams and rivers so that garbage does not wash into them during the monsoons. We demand strict enforcement of rules concerning sewage and waste water treatment and promote cost-effective ways of cleaning waste water before it enters ponds, lakes or streams. PROTECTING BIODIVERSITY We are investigating the nutritional and medicinal value of various mountain herbs and plants such as nettle with a view to multiplying and processing them as a source of livelihood for our farmers. With the help of the Department of Forests and the Indian Army Eco-Battalion, we are doing tree planting of local, broad-leafed species like oak that retain underground water and trees like kafal that provide food for birds and wild animals. PROMOTING ORGANIC FARMING We are raising awareness about the long-term negative effects on the soil and on health of using chemical inputs for food crops. We are also working on the wild plants that can be used to tackle the problem of malnutrition and generate sustainable livelihoods. We provide technical expertise for organic farming and an alternative to chemical fertilisers through the composting of green waste.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SBMA is Committed to a human development approach, SBMA facilitates empowerment of children and women by developing their own capabilities and strengthening their institutions. The underlying principles of SBMA in all its programs are Nurturing community based groups, Developing their capacities for addressing the developmental issues and managing them, Enabling access to services provided by state and private agencies, Creating services where others are not forthcoming, Aggregating community based groups and facilitating them to emerge as community based organization for continuing the interventions initiated by SBMA. SBMA focuses its intervention on Education, Health, Community Governance, Livelihood Promotion, Natural Resource Management & Child Right & Child Protection. In each of the thematic areas SBMA is involved in Capacity building, Advocacy and Networking, Field Implementation & Based Organizations. All programs are catalyzing holistic development of the communities through interventions in Education, livelihood, Health,Water & Sanitation, Disaster Management, Child & Mother Health etc. 40800 in Chmoli and Uttarkashi children derived benefit from de worming campaigning, 14601 persons treated for various ailments through Multi Specialty Health Camps, 1341 pregnant women have received tetanus toxide vaccinations, 592 mothers received Ante Natal Care and Pre Natal Care26 disabled children were recommended for certification,Total 4232 boys and girls in 180 villages examined for nutritional deficiency, 2500 children covered for Hepatitis B vaccine,Approx 500 patients examined and counseled through four specialized camps of RTI&STI.
